decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to quickly cycle through your deck and get cards like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix onto the battlefield for early aggression. The deck also utilizes cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to enable the Delirium mechanic for Nethergoyf and to fuel the graveyard for Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells.

The deck is focused on quickly ramping up mana through spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, then utilizing cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to generate an overwhelming amount of red mana. The key strategy is to play a high number of spells in a turn to trigger Ruby Medallion and reusing them with Past in Flames, generating a large storm count for spells like Wish or Strike It Rich to finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. With the help of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, the deck aims to accelerate its combo potential even further.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to continuously cast spells from the graveyard, combining with Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes a variety of low-cost artifacts and powerful combo pieces like Urza's Saga, Emry, Lurker of the Loch, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate mana and draw cards. Grinding Station is also utilized to mill the opponent's deck and Boseiju, Who Endures can protect key spells from counters. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on using a variety of counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's board and disrupt their game plan. It also utilizes cards like Thought Scour and Unearth to fill the graveyard and bring back powerful creatures like Murktide Regent. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by drawing cards with Feed the Cycle and Consign to Memory, while also being able to close out games with threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Harbinger of the Seas. It seeks to control the game until it can establish a dominant position and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while eventually winning through efficient threats like Murktide Regent. The deck also includes a toolbox of utility spells and lands to provide flexibility in different matchups. By carefully managing resources and making calculated decisions, the Dimir Control deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures with various abilities to combo off for a win. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual, the deck can search for specific creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Wildgrowth Walker to generate value and control the board. The strategy involves sacrificing creatures like Amalia Benavides Aguirre and Gilded Goose with Viscera Seer to trigger powerful effects, while also using cards like Skyclave Apparition and Dewdrop Cure for removal and disruption. The deck aims to create a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate mana production, allowing for early game control with cards like Devourer of Destiny and Sowing Mycospawn. The deck aims to quickly ramp up to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the late game. Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return provide additional control elements, while The One Ring can help generate card advantage. Overall, the deck uses a combination of ramp and control elements to overwhelm opponents with powerful Eldrazi threats.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize mill cards like Glimpse the Unthinkable, Fractured Sanity, and Archive Trap to quickly mill the opponent's library and win the game by forcing them to draw from an empty library. The deck also includes cards like Drown in the Loch and Fatal Push for removal, along with cards like Ensnaring Bridge for protection. The main win condition is to mill the opponent's library completely while controlling the board with removal spells and protection cards.

The deck aims to quickly cycle through cards to fill up the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield in one explosive turn. The deck leverages "cycling" abilities on cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries to dig through the deck quickly and set up for the combo. Endurance provides protection against graveyard hate, while cards like Generous Ent and Shardless Agent help dig for combo pieces. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Negation and Flare of Denial to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost aggressive creatures and using powerful multicolor spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Ragavan and Territorial Kavu with a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to close out games swiftly. Leyline Binding and Stubborn Denial provide disruption and protection, while powerful finishers like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury ensure that the opponent is overwhelmed. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolor strategy and maximize its aggression.
